definition: to close the passes and seal off the country/to close a country to exclude foreign contact
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: The closed-door policy of the Qing dynasty closed people's visions and minds.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國政策封禁了人們的眼界和思想。

sentences.english: The ancient civilization became a byword for isolation and stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國，停滯不前成了這個文明古國的代名詞。

sentences.english: No country can develop healthily with its door closed.
sentences.chinese: 閉關鎖國，任何一個國家都不能健康的發展。

sentences.english: Yet these advantages could all be frittered away if the nation were to close its borders.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們閉關鎖國，排斥移民，這些優勢將蕩然無存。

sentences.english: Turkmenistan's shackling is typical of broader failure in the region.
sentences.chinese: 土庫曼斯坦的閉關鎖國是這個區域更大的失敗。

sentences.english: He proceeds to shut Japan off from the rest of the world, something his successors continue for 250 years.
sentences.chinese: 他從閉關鎖國中獲益，他的繼承人延續到250年後。

sentences.english: When we closed our doors, you launched the Opium War to open our markets.
sentences.chinese: 曾經我們閉關鎖國，你發動鴉片戰爭撞開我們的大門。

sentences.english: Led to a closed-door policy of China to start small-scale peasant .
sentences.chinese: 導致了中國走向了閉關鎖國的小農經濟的開始。
